title: Do you feel like most Americans are materialistic? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Yes, I do feel like most Americans are materialistic. Luke 12:13–21 (NIV bible) “The Parable of the Rich Fool 13 Someone in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.” 14 Jesus replied, “Man, who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you?” 15 Then he said to them, “Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; life does not consist in an abundance of possessions.” 16 And he told them this parable: “The ground of a certain rich man yielded an abundant harvest. 17 He thought to himself, ‘What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.’ 18 “Then he said, ‘This is what I’ll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store my surplus grain. 19 And I’ll say to myself, “You have plenty of grain laid up for many years. Take life easy; eat, drink and be merry.”’ 20 “But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?’ 21 “This is how it will be with whoever stores up things for themselves but is not rich toward God.”  Image source… The Materialism editorial cartoons

Hmm. Of course you understand that there is no cushion here, so we pay for every aspect of our lives with our earnings. We always have our budgets running in the back of our minds. Also, things don’t cost a fortune here unless you buy Lamborghinis so you can get a lot of what you like. Materialistic? Maybe. I will be interested to see what other responses have to say about this.

Yes we are ….The latest technology of itself alone and in every thing we own…We think in terms of acquiring money to acquire more stuff….We spend more time inside of video media ,and very little getting to know ourselves ,our own minds … My opinion…
Yes, very much so. It is the direct cause of so much of the rot in American society that has been evident the past fifty years.
